column1: The accused-appellant preferred this appeal against the said conviction and sentences.
The grounds of appeal are as follows;

column2: The learned High Court Judge misdirected with regard to the admissibility of the
evidence  against  the  1st  and  the  3rd  counts  when  there  is  no  proof  against  the
accused appellant and thereby the conviction against the 1st and the 3rd counts are

prosecution has failed to establish the time of death and thereby to establish the

Learned Trial Judge misdirected herself by failure to appreciate the version of the

probability factors of each side and thereby that casts a reasonable doubt on the
The  learned  High  Court  Judge  misdirected  herself  by  failure  to  evaluate  all  the

beyond reasonable doubt and therefore the conclusion that accused appellant is
guilty of all counts, are bad in Law.
